person.persName: Richard Henry Stanton (Maysville, Kentucky, attorney and legal writer)

body.p: Maysville, Kentucky, attorney and legal writer. Alexandria, District of Columbia, native. Married to Asenath Throop Stanton in 1833. Father of Henry Thompson Stanton, Clarence L. Stanton, Asenath Stanton, Charlotte E. Stanton, Ella Stanton, Richard Henry Stanton, Jr., and Maria Stanton. Attended Hallowell Academy in Alexandria. Worked as a bricklayer with his father, Richard H. Stanton. Moved to Kentucky in 1835. Studied law and admitted to the bar in 1839. Editor of the Maysville Monitor from 1839 to 1841. Member of the Democratic Party. Member of the Democratic Convention at Baltimore in 1844 and 1852. Postmaster of Maysville from 1845 to 1849. Owned one enslaved person in 1850. Member of the House of Representatives of the United States from 1849 to 1855. Presidential elector for James Buchanan in 1856. Commonwealth's attorney for the Tenth Judicial District of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1857 to 1862. Owned one enslaved person and hired one enslaved person in 1860. Compiled The Revised Statutes of Kentucky, Volume II, published in 1860. Arrested for disloyalty by General Nelson in October 1861 and released from custody in December 1861.
